intro: Lychnis attenuata, commonly known as the lesser catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features pink to red flowers with five petals, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Lychnis attenuata thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
